result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa M Jordan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Lisa M Jordan in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Lisa M Jordan in custody.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Motion Hearing. Arguments from state and defense counsel. For reasons placed on the record the court DENIED the defense motion. Sentence stands.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lisa M Jordan in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction, FORTHWITH, consecutive to any other sentence including probation sentence in case 14CF588, BUT concurrent to Count 3, with credit for 6 DAYS time served, with Huber privileges for work and treatment. Pay all Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation on case 14CF588, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 

AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction, FORTHWITH, consecutive to any other sentence including probation sentence in case 14CF588, BUT concurrent to Count 1, with credit for 6 DAYS time served, with Huber privileges for work and treatment. Pay all Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation on case 14CF588, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
 Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit.

AS TO COUNT 2 
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion from the state, the court ordered Count 2 Dismissed, But Read In for sentencing.
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Lisa M Jordan in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Michael Thurston for Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion from the state, the court ordered Count1 amended to 2 COUNTS (Count 1 & Count 3) of Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wis. Stat 940.19(1) a class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MEJ, unless approved and monitored by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare and/or Children's Court.

Defendant Lisa M Jordan in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court joined case with 14CF588. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lisa M Jordan in court with attorney Matthew Lamke.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds  

Case heard for Br. 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lisa M Jordan in court with attorney Matthew Lamke.  Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  
JUDGE FLANAGAN, BRANCH 4 FOR JUDGE GRADY, BRANCH 23. 
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23 .  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Branch 23 in trial, case spun to branch 04, Judge Flanagan
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MEJ dob 11/3/98 unless as approved per Children's Court Orders, or if Children's Court is not involved, unless as approved per the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.

Defendant Lisa M Jordan in court with attorney Matthew Lamke.  Defendant Lisa M Jordan in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
